page.title: 07NEAR LEYS FARM (continued)
page.content: ....726 litres.Cleanliness is very important & milk is piped through overhead glass pipes from the milking parlour.An emergency tank is used if snow or bad weather prevents the tanker from reaching the farm.They do not keep a bull but inject the cows to give them a calf.Bull calves are sold at the market.Nose operated fountains make sure that the cows can always get a drink.We saw 6 cats which seem to run wild round the farm.Mr.Wearmouth was born in this farm & with his father owns & works the 96 acres.He is pleased that the cut in his milk quota has been restored.He believes in using only natural fertilizers and putting in maximum hours.In fact he has had only 4 days holiday in 14 years but he is a cheerful man.
